html: The heavens vanishing as by smoke, the earth’s wearing out like a garment, and its inhabitants perishing like vermin (cf. Isaiah 5:30; 14:31; 24:4-6) represent the earth’s return to chaos that ends its present cycle before it regenerates to a paradisiacal state. Because salvation follows righteousness (Isaiah 45:8; 46:13; 56:1), salvation—as typified by the earth’s regeneration (v 3)—depends on its inhabitants attaining a state of righteousness. On these principles of salvation preceded by righteousness—exemplified by Jehovah and his servant—rests all that doesn’t die (Isaiah 35:1-7; 58:8, 11; 60:17-22).
